code: forest_plot(   data,   abline = TRUE,   col_padj = FALSE,   p.adjust.methods = "bonferroni",   p.adjust.n = NULL,   xlim = c(0, 4),   ticks_at = c(0, 0.5, 1, 2, 3) )

title: Return the forest plot — forest_plot
text: data harmonization(using function harmonise_data) abline abline forest plot col_padj forestplot figure adjust_pval col p.adjust.methods p.adjust.methods,c("holm", "hochberg", "hommel", "bonferroni", "BH", "", "fdr", "none") p.adjust.n number comparisons, must least length(p); set (non-default) know ! xlim forestploter packages param,xlim=c(0,4) ticks_at forestploter packages param, ticks_at=c(0,0.5,1, 2, 3)

what: How to get rsID from chromosome and position — get_rsID_from_chrpos
title: How to get rsID from chromosome and position — get_rsID_from_chrpos
How to get rsID from chromosome and position — get_rsID_from_chrpos
code: get_rsID_from_chrpos(   dat,   col_chr = "chr",   col_pos = "start",   col_ref_allele = "refAllele",   col_alt_allele = "altAllele",   col_snp = "SNP",   build = "37",   pop = "EUR",   database = "dbsnp" )

title: How to get rsID from chromosome and position — get_rsID_from_chrpos
text: dat dataframe exposure outcome col_chr chromosome default "chr_col". col_pos chromosome position col_ref_allele Name column non effect allele. Must contain characters "", "C", "T" "G". default "refAllele". col_alt_allele Name column effect allele. Must contain characters "", "C", "T" "G". default "altAllele" col_snp Required name column SNP rs IDs. default "SNP". build version pop investigated population database dbsnp database

title: How to get rsID from chromosome and position — get_rsID_from_chrpos
